Mesh

Mesh

class flatiron_tk.mesh.mesh.Mesh(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

This class is a wrapper for the dolfinx mesh class. It provides a simple interface for creating and manipulating meshes.

Dev-Notes:

  • In previous interations of FLATiron, we used “mesh” as the name for fenics the mesh objects. We will discontinue this practice and use “msh” instead. This way, we can use dolfinx demos (which use msh to hold their objects) more easily.

cell_diameter()[source]

Returns the ufl cell diameter of the mesh.

facet_normal()[source]

Returns the ufl facet normal of the mesh.

fdim()[source]

Returns the topological dimension of the facet in the mesh.

gdim()[source]

Returns the geometric dimension of the mesh; the dimension of the physical space in which the mesh is embedded.

This is usually the same as the topological dimension, but can be different in some cases (e.g., when using a 2D mesh in 3D space — a shell mesh).

get_boundary_area(boundary_id)[source]

Calculate the area of a given boundary.

Parameters:

boundary_id (int) – The id of the boundary for which to compute the area.

Returns:

The area of the boundary.

Return type:

float

get_boundary_centroid(boundary_id)[source]

Calculate the centroid of a given boundary.

Parameters:

boundary_id (int) – The id of the boundary for which to compute the centroid.

Returns:

A vector representing the centroid of the boundary.

Return type:

np.ndarray

mark_boundary(marking_dict)[source]

Mark the boundary of the mesh with user-defined markers.

Parameters:

marking_dict – dict, A dictionary where keys are marker ids and values are functions that return boolean arrays indicating which entities to mark.

mark_subdomain(marking_dict)[source]

Mark the subdomain of the mesh with user-defined markers.

Parameters:

marking_dict – dict, A dictionary where keys are marker ids and values are functions that return boolean arrays indicating which entities to mark.

mean_boundary_normal(boundary_id)[source]

Calculate the mean boundary normal vector for a given boundary id.

Parameters:

boundary_id (int) – The id of the boundary for which to compute the mean normal vector.

Returns:

A normalized vector of the mean boundary normal.

Return type:

np.ndarray

num_facets_local()[source]

Return local number of facets

tdim()[source]

Returns the topological dimension of the mesh; the dimension of the reference element in the mesh.
